intro: Keraselma falcatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed keratophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves that are often arranged in a feathery pattern. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is typically found in dry, rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Keraselma falcatum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
